site_name: Electricity Charging Point Adjacent Langholm Cottage
description: INSTALLATION OF TWO ELECTRICAL VEHICULAR CHARGING POINTS AND ONE FEEDER PILLAR ON PUBLIC FOOTWAY
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: SL-003 Rev A

Condition : 3 - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - INFORMATIVE
You are advised to contact the Council's Highways Team on 020 8545 3700 before undertaking any works within the Public Highway to obtain the necessary approvals and/or licences. Please be advised that there is a further charge for this work. If your application falls within a Controllled Parking  Zone this has further costs involved and can delay the application by 6 to 12 months.

Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE
Any works/evemts carried out either by, or at the behest of, the developer, whether they are located on, or affecting a prospectively maintainable highway, as defined under Section 87 of the New Roads and Street Works Act 1991, or on or affectingthe public highway, shall be co-ordinatedunder the requirements of the New roads and Street Works Act 1991 and Traffic Management Act 2004 and licensed accordingly in order to secure the expediitious movement of traffic by minimising disrution to users of the highway network in Merton. any such works or events commisioned by the developer and particuraly those involving the connection of any utility to the site, shall be co-ordinated by them in liaison  with the London Borough of Merton, Network Coordinator, (telephone 020 8545 3976). This must take place at least one month in advance of the works and particuraly to ensure that statutory undertaker connections/supplies to the site are co-ordinated to take place wherever possible at the same time.

Condition : 6 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner. in this instance the application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
